actions.committee: House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service.

committees.committee: House Post Office and Civil Service

official_title: To amend title 5, United States Code, to improve the civil service retirement benefits of employees engaged in the enforcement of the criminal laws of the United States, and for other purpose.

summary.text: Entitles employees engaged in criminal law enforcement activities to immediate civil service retirement after completing 20 years of service, without the requirement of having abtained 50 years of age. Increases the annuity payment of such employees. Provides a $50,000 special death benefit to survivors of law enforcement employees killed in the line of duty. (Amends 5 U.S.C. 8336(c), 8339(d); Adds 5 U.S.C. 5585)

titles.title: To amend title 5, United States Code, to improve the civil service retirement benefits of employees engaged in the enforcement of the criminal laws of the United States, and for other purpose.
